column4: I pledge to live by the Golden Rule: do unto others as I would have them do unto me.
I pledge to live in accordance with The Pillars Core Values.
I pledge to live in accordance with the Top 10 Morals.
I pledge to Reduce, Re-use, Recycle and Compost.
I pledge to be a good ancestor.
I pledge to grow a small (or as large as I can) flower, herb or vegetable garden; orchard; farm; or preserve.
I pledge to eat less meat or become a vegetarian.
column5: Eat less meat example: Meatless Mondays, 1 Meatless Month/Year

column4: I pledge to assist my family and the village that raised me more than I thought I could.
column5: Volunteer if you never have. Step up volunteering effort if already an avid volunteer.

column4: I pledge to be kind, especially to myself and those I love.
I pledge to donate time, skill-set or money annually to the Seven Pillars.

column3: The Natural Born Citizen Pledge Group
column4: I hereby pledge that I absolutely and entirely renounce and abjure all allegiance and fidelity to any foreign prince, potentate, state, or sovereignty, of whom or which I have heretofore been a subject or citizen; that I will support and defend the Constitution and laws of the United States of America against all enemies, foreign and domestic; that I will bear true faith and allegiance to the same; that I will bear arms on behalf of the United States when required by the law; that I will perform noncombatant service in the Armed Forces of the United States when required by the law; that I will perform work of national importance under civilian direction when required by the law; and that I take this obligation freely, without any mental reservation or purpose of evasion.
column5: The same pledge new USA citizens make without reference to God. This is specifically for naturally born citizens that never had to make said pledge.
